ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Catalog of Flare Events observed by the TIMED-SEE experiment.

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

Added MetadataRightsList. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Updated to 2.7.1. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: This page is a catalog of flare events observed by the TIMED Solar EUV Experiment (SEE). Each row contains NOAA SEC flare information from the daily edited event reports for periods when TIMED-SEE was observing the sun anywhere between the start and stop times of these events. Events have been filtered to exclude periods when no appreciable increases were detected by SEE.

Parameter.Name: Stop
Parameter.Description: Time at the end of the event

Parameter.Name:
Solar
Longitude (deg)
Parameter.Description: Heliographic latitude of x-ray flare defined by SXI or H-alpha when no SXI location is reported.

Parameter.Name: Solar Latitude (deg)
Parameter.Description: Heliographic longitude of x-ray flare defined by SXI or H-alpha when no SXI location is reported

Parameter.Name: SEE-XPS Index
Parameter.Description: SEE-XPS Index - TIMED-SEE XPS (0.1-7 nm) Flare Index (1=no flare, >1=flare).

Parameter.Name: SEE obs (seconds after peak)
Parameter.Description: Center of the TIMED-SEE observation time relative to the flare peak expressed in seconds. SEE observations are approximately 180 seconds. Positive numbers indicate seconds after the peak, negative numbers indicate seconds prior to the peak.
